text: Walter Offley (15 July 1682 – 18 August 1721) was an English Anglican priest, most notably Dean of ChesterBritish History on-line from 1718 until his death."The history of the county palatine of Chester" Hanshall, J. H p101: Self published, Chester, 1823 Offley was born in Crewe and educated at Oriel College, Oxford. He was also concurrently the Archdeacon of Staffordshire.Horn, Joyce M. (2003), Fasti Ecclesiae Anglicanae 1541–1857, 10, pp. 14–16 He was Chaplain to Henry Herbert, 2nd Baron Herbert of Chirbury. ==Notes== Category:1682 births Category:1721 deaths Category:18th-century English Anglican priests Category:Deans of Chester Category:Alumni of Oriel College, Oxford Category:People from Crewe
title: Walter Offley
